New Records: Mohammed Shami became India's leading wicket-taker in 50-over World Cups.
Key Match Events: Virat Kohli and Shubman Gill put on 189 for India's second wicket.
Mohammed Shami took five wickets for 18 runs.
Dilshan Madushanka bowled Rohit Sharma off the second ball of the India innings.
Kohli survived a tough caught-and-bowled chance off Dushmantha Chameera when he was on 10.
Madushanka had Gill caught behind for 92.
Madushanka claimed his third wicket with Kohli on 88.
Shreyas Iyer became the third Indian batter to pass 80.
Sri Lanka lost four wickets for three runs inside four overs.
Pathum Nissanka was trapped lbw by Jasprit Bumrah off the first ball.
Mohammed Siraj snared Dimuth Karunaratne and Sadeera Samarawickrama in the second over and bowled Kusal Mendis with the first ball of the fourth over.
Charith Asalanka was caught by Ravindra Jadeja off the bowling of Shami.
Dushan Hemantha was caught behind by KL Rahul.
Chameera went for a duck in Shami's next over.
Only Angelo Mathews, Maheesh Theekshana, and Kasun Rajitha reached double figures for Sri Lanka.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma expressed happiness about officially qualifying for the knockout stages and praised the team's clinical performance.
Kusal Mendis reflected on the decision to bowl first, noting the challenging seam and swing conditions at night.
